column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=A week later
#Text=I should have finished this letter long ago , but I did n't .
#Text=You do n't mind , do you , Daddy , if I 'm not very regular ?
#Text=I really do love to write to you ; it gives me such a respectable feeling of having some family .
#Text=Would you like me to tell you something ?
#Text=You are not the only man to whom I write letters .
#Text=There are two others !
#Text=I have been receiving beautiful long letters this winter from Master Jervie ( with typewritten envelopes so Julia wo n't recognize the writing ) .
#Text=Did you ever hear anything so shocking ?
#Text=And every week or so a very scrawly epistle , usually on yellow tablet paper , arrives from Princeton .
#Text=All of which I answer with business-like promptness .
#Text=So you see -- I am not so different from other girls -- I get letters , too .
#Text=Did I tell you that I have been elected a member of the Senior Dramatic Club ?
#Text=Very recherche organization .
#Text=Only seventy-five members out of one thousand .
#Text=Do you think as a consistent Socialist that I ought to belong ?
#Text=What do you suppose is at present engaging my attention in sociology ?
#Text=I am writing ( figurez vous ! )
#Text=a paper on the Care of Dependent Children .
#Text=The Professor shuffled up his subjects and dealt them out promiscuously , and that fell to me .
#Text=C'est drole
#Text=ca n'est pas ?
#Text=There goes the gong for dinner .
#Text=I 'll post this as I pass the box .
#Text=Affectionately , J.
#Text=4th June
#Text=Dear Daddy ,
#Text=Very busy time -- commencement in ten days , examinations tomorrow ; lots of studying , lots of packing , and the outdoor world so lovely that it hurts you to stay inside .
#Text=But never mind , vacation 's coming .
#Text=Julia is going abroad this summer -- it makes the fourth time .
#Text=No doubt about it , Daddy , goods are not distributed evenly .
#Text=Sallie , as usual , goes to the Adirondacks .
#Text=And what do you think I am going to do ?
#Text=You may have three guesses .
#Text=Lock Willow ?
#Text=Wrong .
#Text=The Adirondacks with Sallie ?
#Text=Wrong .
#Text=( I 'll never attempt that again ; I was discouraged last year . )
#Text=Ca n't you guess anything else ?
#Text=You 're not very inventive .
#Text=I 'll tell you , Daddy , if you 'll promise not to make a lot of objections .
#Text=I warn your secretary in advance that my mind is made up .
#Text=I am going to spend the summer at the seaside with a Mrs. Charles Paterson and tutor her daughter who is to enter college in the autumn .
#Text=I met her through the McBrides , and she is a very charming woman .
#Text=I am to give lessons in English and Latin to the younger daughter , too , but I shall have a little time to myself , and I shall be earning fifty dollars a month !
#Text=Does n't that impress you as a perfectly exorbitant amount ?
#Text=She offered it ; I should have blushed to ask for more than twenty-five .
#Text=I finish at Magnolia ( that 's where she lives ) the first of September , and shall probably spend the remaining three weeks at Lock Willow --
#Text=I should like to see the Semples again and all the friendly animals .
#Text=How does my programme strike you , Daddy ?
#Text=I am getting quite independent , you see .
#Text=You have put me on my feet and I think I can almost walk alone by now .
#Text=Princeton commencement and our examinations exactly coincide -- which is an awful blow .
#Text=Sallie and I did so want to get away in time for it , but of course that is utterly impossible .
#Text=Goodbye , Daddy .
#Text=Have a nice summer and come back in the autumn rested and ready for another year of work .
#Text=( That 's what you ought to be writing to me ! )
#Text=I have n't any idea what you do in the summer , or how you amuse yourself .
#Text=I ca n't visualize your surroundings .
#Text=Do you play golf or hunt or ride horseback or just sit in the sun and meditate ?
#Text=Anyway , whatever it is , have a good time and do n't forget Judy .
#Text=10th June
#Text=Dear Daddy ,
#Text=This is the hardest letter I ever wrote , but I have decided what I must do , and there is n't going to be any turning back .
#Text=It is very sweet and generous and dear of you to wish to send me to Europe this summer -- for the moment I was intoxicated by the idea ; but sober second thoughts said no .
#Text=It would be rather illogical of me to refuse to take your money for college , and then use it instead just for amusement !
#Text=You must n't get me used to too many luxuries .

#Text=One does n't miss what one has never had ; but it 's awfully hard going without things after one has commenced thinking they are his -- hers ( English language needs another pronoun ) by natural right .
#Text=Living with Sallie and Julia is an awful strain on my stoical philosophy .
#Text=They have both had things from the time they were babies ; they accept happiness as a matter of course .
#Text=The World , they think , owes them everything they want .
#Text=Maybe the World does -- in any case , it seems to acknowledge the debt and pay up .
#Text=But as for me , it owes me nothing , and distinctly told me so in the beginning .
#Text=I have no right to borrow on credit , for there will come a time when the World will repudiate my claim .
#Text=I seem to be floundering in a sea of metaphor -- but I hope you grasp my meaning ?
#Text=Anyway , I have a very strong feeling that the only honest thing for me to do is to teach this summer and begin to support myself .
